body_html:
The inability to reinforce subsets of stochastic nodes is still a real annoyance in other cases.

The fact that

sample = a.multinomial()
sample[0].reinforce(1)

doesn't work is pretty surprising given that autograd works with indexing in every other situation. As is I'm going to write some pretty annoying code to get my returns into the right shape.

The inability to reinforce subsets of stochastic nodes is still a real annoyance in other cases.
The fact that
sample = a.multinomial()

doesn't work is pretty surprising given that autograd works with indexing in every other situation. As is I'm going to write some pretty annoying code to get my returns into the right shape.
body:
The inability to reinforce subsets of stochastic nodes is still a real annoyance in other cases.

The fact that 

```python
sample = a.multinomial()
sample[0].reinforce(1)
```

doesn't work is pretty surprising given that autograd works with indexing in every other situation. As is I'm going to write some pretty annoying code to get my returns into the right shape.
